alert.note: Alert for Hall; Hamilton; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 29 at 3:57AM CDT until March 29 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...DANGEROUS FIRE WEATHER LIKELY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 062, 063 AND 064... The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 8 PM CDT this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...In Nebraska, Fire Weather Zone 062 Hall, Fire Weather Zone 063 Hamilton and Fire Weather Zone 064 York. * WINDS...From the South to Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * TIMING...1 PM to 8PM Tuesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite may spread rapidly and exhibit extreme fire behavior. Use extreme caution if engaging in activities that could lead to fire ignition. In addition, if any fires remain active after sunset, they will be impacted by a significant wind shift to northerly behind a cold front.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
